    Execution Modes¶

    Execution modes for agent orchestration.

    Execution modes for agent graph orchestration.

    Defines three execution modes: - ManualController: Step-by-step manual control - ReactiveExecutor: Message-driven automatic execution - ProactiveExecutor: Periodic agent activation

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ExecutionMode(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Bases: ABC

    Abstract base class for execution modes.

    Execution modes control how messages are processed and agents are executed in the graph. Only one execution mode can be active at a time.

    __init__(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Initialize an execution mode.

    Parameters:¶
    graph: AgentGraph¶

    Reference to the AgentGraph instance

    async start() → None[source]¶

    Start the execution mode.

    Raises:¶

    RuntimeError – If execution mode is already running

    async stop() → None[source]¶

    Stop the execution mode and wait for cleanup.

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ManualController(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Bases: ExecutionMode

    Manual execution mode for step-by-step control.

    The graph doesn’t automatically process messages. The user must explicitly call step() to execute specific agents or step_all() to execute all agents with pending messages.

    async step(node_id: str) → None[source]¶

    Execute one turn for a specific agent.

    Processes one pending message from the agent’s queue, if any. If no messages are pending, does nothing.

    Parameters:¶
    node_id: str¶

    ID of the agent to execute

    Raises:¶

    ValueError – If node_id doesn’t exist

    async step_all() → int[source]¶

    Execute one turn for all agents with pending messages.

    Returns:¶

    Number of agents that had pending messages and were executed

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ReactiveExecutor(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Bases: ExecutionMode

    Reactive execution mode (event-driven).

    Automatically processes messages from agent queues as they arrive. When a message is added to an agent’s queue, the agent processes it asynchronously.

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ProactiveExecutor(graph: AgentGraph, interval: float = 60.0, start_delay: float = 0.0)[source]¶

    Bases: ExecutionMode

    Proactive execution mode (periodic agent activation).

    Agents wake up periodically and can initiate conversations without waiting for incoming messages. Useful for polling, monitoring, or background tasks.

    __init__(graph: AgentGraph, interval: float = 60.0, start_delay: float = 0.0)[source]¶

    Initialize the proactive executor.

    Parameters:¶
    graph: AgentGraph¶

    Reference to the AgentGraph instance

    interval: float = 60.0¶

    Seconds between agent activations (default: 60)

    start_delay: float = 0.0¶

    Seconds before first activation (default: 0)

    Base ExecutionMode¶

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ExecutionMode(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Abstract base class for execution modes.

    Execution modes control how messages are processed and agents are executed in the graph. Only one execution mode can be active at a time.

    __init__(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Initialize an execution mode.

    Parameters:¶
    graph: AgentGraph¶

    Reference to the AgentGraph instance

    async start() → None[source]¶

    Start the execution mode.

    Raises:¶

    RuntimeError – If execution mode is already running

    async stop() → None[source]¶

    Stop the execution mode and wait for cleanup.

    ManualController¶

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ManualController(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Manual execution mode for step-by-step control.

    The graph doesn’t automatically process messages. The user must explicitly call step() to execute specific agents or step_all() to execute all agents with pending messages.

    async step(node_id: str) → None[source]¶

    Execute one turn for a specific agent.

    Processes one pending message from the agent’s queue, if any. If no messages are pending, does nothing.

    Parameters:¶
    node_id: str¶

    ID of the agent to execute

    Raises:¶

    ValueError – If node_id doesn’t exist

    async step_all() → int[source]¶

    Execute one turn for all agents with pending messages.

    Returns:¶

    Number of agents that had pending messages and were executed

    ReactiveExecutor¶

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ReactiveExecutor(graph: AgentGraph)[source]¶

    Reactive execution mode (event-driven).

    Automatically processes messages from agent queues as they arrive. When a message is added to an agent’s queue, the agent processes it asynchronously.

    ProactiveExecutor¶

    class claude_agent_graph.execution.ProactiveExecutor(graph: AgentGraph, interval: float = 60.0, start_delay: float = 0.0)[source]¶

    Proactive execution mode (periodic agent activation).

    Agents wake up periodically and can initiate conversations without waiting for incoming messages. Useful for polling, monitoring, or background tasks.

    __init__(graph: AgentGraph, interval: float = 60.0, start_delay: float = 0.0)[source]¶

    Initialize the proactive executor.

    Parameters:¶
    graph: AgentGraph¶

    Reference to the AgentGraph instance

    interval: float = 60.0¶

    Seconds between agent activations (default: 60)

    start_delay: float = 0.0¶

    Seconds before first activation (default: 0)
